---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [8c38774e3e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18717/commits/8c38774e3ed614d80548460d793bef2a7a83e630)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.RingHomProperties | 1732 | 1733 | +1 (+0.06%) |
| Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Smooth | 1760 | 1761 | +1 (+0.06%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.RingHomProperties` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Smooth` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.FinitePresentation` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.FiniteType`</details>|1|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ RingHom.LocalizationAwayPreserves`
`+ RingHom.LocalizationAwayPreserves.respectsIso`
`+ RingHom.OfLocalizationSpanTarget.ofLocalizationSpan`
`+ RingHom.StableUnderCompositionWithLocalizationAwayLeft`
`+ RingHom.StableUnderCompositionWithLocalizationAwayRight`
`+ Scheme.Opens.toSpecΓ_SpecMap_map`
`+ Scheme.Opens.toSpecΓ_top`
`+ SpecMapRestrictBasicOpenIso`
`+ Spec_basicOpen`
`+ affineOpenCoverOfSpanRangeEqTop`
`+ algebraMap_Spec_obj`
`+ instance {R : CommRingCat} {U} : Algebra R Γ(Spec R, U)`
`+ instance {R : CommRingCat} {f : R} :`
`+ isLocal_ringHomProperty_of_isLocalAtSource_of_isLocalAtTarget`
`+ locally_localizationAwayPreserves`
`+ locally_stableUnderCompositionWithLocalizationAwayLeft`
`+ locally_stableUnderCompositionWithLocalizationAwayRight`
`+ of_isLocalAtSource_of_isLocalAtTarget`
`+ stalkwise`
`+ stalkwise_Spec_map_iff`
`+ stalkwise_isLocalAtSource_of_respectsIso`
`- RingHom.PropertyIsLocal.ofLocalizationSpan`
`- locally_stableUnderCompositionWithLocalizationAway`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
This is no longer an instance. Does this cause problems?

I am a bit sad about it, but I still agree that weakening is good. Maybe we can add a `HasStrongRingHomProperty` extending `HasRingHomProperty` with the `RingHom.StableUnderCompositionWithLocalizationAwayLeft` as an extra assumption? Or maybe even call the new `PropertyIsLocal` `PropertyIsPreLocal` and let `PropertyIsLocal` extend `PropertyIsPreLocal` with the additional field `RingHom.StableUnderCompositionWithLocalizationAwayLeft`.
Then we would have alignment with the stacks project definition https://stacks.math.columbia.edu/tag/01SR.
Alternatively we could think about migrating to a type synonym `RingHomProperty` and then define all these properties as typeclasses.

For this specific case it might be nice to establish `RingHom.StableUnderCompositionWithLocalizationAwayLeft` <=> `Respects IsOpenImmersion` but then I think we can just use `HasRingHomProperty` + `Respects IsOpenImmersion` later on.

In general it might be nice to migrate to typeclasses for these ringhom properties. It doesn't cause any immediate pain for me though so I probably won't work on this refactor for the near future.
Not sure if this should be a `simp` lemma. Sometimes we certainly want to use general results about algebras instead of unfolding the definition.
I think the lemmas concerning `algebraMap` are useful only when dealing with elements and smul etc, which we seldom do in AG.
I wonder if one day `egg` with an AG tailored rule set can solve these goals.
I think the main friction comes from (again!) the switch from category theoretic arrows to RingHoms and back.
Maybe `stalkwise_Spec_map_iff`? For some reason GH does not let me suggest changes.
I think `P` should be explicit here.
Is this the right naming? In the `RingHom.comp` sense, we compose on the right here.
Yeah I am taking the `>>` direction.
What about `StableUnderCompositionWithLocalizationAwaySource` vs `StableUnderCompositionWithLocalizationAwayTarget`? (In alignment with the `OfLocalizationSpan` terminology)?

pullRequest.title: refactor(AlgebraicGeometry): weaken `RingHom.PropertyIsLocal`
